title: How to merge two or more songs on FL Studio - Quora

response.answer_text: Import both songs into a new FL session file and save it as "Live Set"or something along those lines: You could bounce each song as individual stems (ie. vocals, drums, synths etc.) for each track in the song and reassemble them in this "live set" or just bounce the song as a whole.  Now you have the arrangements in one session file make sure the tempo grid is set for each. If there is a speed up/slow down between each song use automation to adjust the grid between them. Once tempo matched you can start adjusting the space between the tracks and add any fade in/out content to begin blending them. Hope this helps

If you're talking about making a mashup, then simply place the two tracks on fl studio and mash them however you like.If you're talking about mixing those two tracks, like in a DJ mix, then you should download Deckadence. It's a mixing app for FL Studio. You can also try using Virtual DJ which is a good DJing software.

Quite simple, go to your selected song inside of your file explorer and then just drag it from the file explorer onto the playlist of FL studio, and then when a little icon saying ‘Link’ then just let go and it will automatically import the song into the playlist, and then you can just keep doing this until you have all your desired songs you wish to mix on your playlist.
